column4: I got a little problem with GRUB.  I made a GRUB floppy boot disk.  When I try to boot from it, all it says is GRUB and nothing else and doesn't do anything.  I can't see any files on it in Windows XP (which I am on now).  What should I do so I can boot into my newly installed Kubuntu?
You probably want to learn a few basic Grub commands ?
But the simplest way would probably be to use a Knoppix or an Ubuntu boot cd to install Grub on your MBR
I stick the floppy in, turn computer on, it read floppy, and all it says is GRUB with a cursor after it.  It does nothing else.  It asks me nothing.
I can't install GRUB to MBR.  WIndows XP is on a SATA hard drive (C:)
Yup, that looks like Grub all right :) It is like a mini-shell, there are commands you can run
I see... I don't know a lot about this...
Serial-ATA hard drive don't have MBR ?
It won;t ask me right off the bat if I want to boot Ubuntu?
It won't right to its MBR for some reason.
But you probably need to install it on the MBR of your first drive...
Probably because the only way I can install Linux on my computer is to run "boot: linux pci-noacpi"
Sorry, I don't know much more than that
You can still try to learn a few basic GRUB commands
Should be able to find this with Google
But I find it weird it couldn't be installed onto the MBR
I guess Google might help you about this ("MBR" "SATA", etc.)
